<h2>#10 - Check if a property is in a Object</h2> <blockquote><p>2016-01-10 by <a href="https://www.twitter.com/loverajoel">@loverajoel</a></p></blockquote> <p>When you have to check if a property is present on an <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Working_with_Objects">object</a>, you probably are doing something like this:</p> <p><code></code>`javascript var myObject = { name: &#39;@tips_js&#39; };</p> <p>if (myObject.name) { ... }</p> <p><code></code>`</p> <p>That&#39;s ok, but you have to know that there are two native ways for this kind of thing, the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/in"><code>in</code> operator</a> and <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/hasOwnProperty"><code>Object.hasOwnProperty</code></a>, every object descended from <code>Object</code>, has both ways available.</p> <h3>See the big Difference</h3> <p><code></code>`javascript var myObject = { name: &#39;@tips_js&#39; };</p> <p>myObject.hasOwnProperty(&#39;name&#39;); // true &#39;name&#39; in myObject; // true</p> <p>myObject.hasOwnProperty(&#39;valueOf&#39;); // false, valueOf is inherited from the prototype chain &#39;valueOf&#39; in myObject; // true</p> <p><code></code>`</p> <p>Both differ in the depth that they check the properties, in other words <code>hasOwnProperty</code> will only return true if key is available on that object directly, however the <code>in</code> operator doesn&#39;t discriminate between properties created on an object and properties inherited from the prototype chain.</p> <p>Here&#39;s another example</p> <p><code></code>`javascript var myFunc = function() { this.name = &#39;@tips_js&#39;; }; myFunc.prototype.age = &#39;10 days&#39;;</p> <p>var user = new myFunc();</p> <p>user.hasOwnProperty(&#39;name&#39;); // true user.hasOwnProperty(&#39;age&#39;); // false, because age is from the prototype chain <code></code>`</p> <p>Check here for <a href="https://jsbin.com/tecoqa/edit?js,console">live examples</a>!</p> <p>I also recommend reading <a href="https://github.com/loverajoel/jstips/issues/62">this discussion</a> about common mistakes made when checking a properties&#39; existence in objects.</p>
